wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the Unlimotion system. Explain its purpose as a hierarchical task management application with unlimited nesting, multi-parent tasks, and blocking relationships. Describe the core goals of enabling complex project planning with visual roadmap views and cross-platform accessibility. Outline the target audience including personal productivity users and professional teams. Detail key features such as task states (Not Completed, In Progress, Completed, Archived), four types of task relationships (Parents, Containing, Blocking By, Blocked), and interface components including breadcrumbs, task panels, and tabbed views. Document the conceptual model of task availability based on contained and blocking tasks, and explain how the UI reflects blocked states through visual transparency. Include practical examples from the README showing task creation workflows and drag-and-drop interactions. Address common user scenarios like creating sibling and inner tasks using keyboard shortcuts, and managing task hierarchies through mouse operations with modifier keys. Provide context for how this system differs from traditional task managers through its support for multiple parents and complex dependency chains.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task States
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the Unlimotion task state system. Explain the four distinct states: Not Completed, In Progress, Completed, and Archived, detailing their visual representation in the UI (checkbox styles and icons). Describe the valid state transitions as defined in the state diagram from the README, including creation, deletion, and modification workflows. Document how each state affects task availability and blocking logic, particularly how archived tasks (IsCompleted = null) are treated as completed for dependency resolution. Include practical examples from the codebase showing state management in TaskItem.cs and how state changes trigger availability recalculations in TaskTreeManager. Address common user scenarios such as pausing tasks (In Progress), marking final completion, and preserving tasks without cluttering the active list (Archived). Provide guidance on best practices for state usage in project planning and workflow management.

wiki_catalogs.name: MVVM Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for Unlimotion's MVVM implementation. Describe how the Avalonia UI framework binds XAML views to ReactiveUI-powered ViewModels in the Unlimotion.ViewModel project. Explain the role of [AddINotifyPropertyChangedInterface] from Fody to automate property change notifications. Detail the binding between MainWindow.axaml and MainWindowViewModel, including DataContext initialization in App.axaml.cs. Document the use of ReactiveCommand for UI actions like task creation and deletion, and how these commands interact with the TaskTreeManager and ITaskStorage services. Illustrate the transformation of domain models (TaskItem) into reactive view models (TaskItemViewModel) for UI binding. Explain the use of DynamicData to manage observable collections and handle real-time updates across multiple views (All Tasks, Unlocked, Completed, etc.). Include examples from MainWindowViewModel's Connect() method showing how data streams are filtered, sorted, and bound to UI elements. Address common MVVM patterns in the codebase such as WhenAnyValue for property observation, disposable management for memory leak prevention, and the use of Splat for service location between View and ViewModel.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Unlimotion's task management system focused on hierarchical task organization with unlimited nesting and multiple parent support. Explain how the TaskItem model's ContainsTasks, ParentTasks, BlocksTasks, and BlockedByTasks collections enable complex task relationships. Detail the implementation of task creation operations (CreateSibling, CreateBlockedSibling, CreateInner) in MainWindowViewModel and their delegation to TaskTreeManager. Describe the cloning and moving operations that preserve task relationships. Document the blocking logic that prevents task completion when uncompleted contained or blocking tasks exist, using the IsCanBeCompleted property managed by TaskTreeManager. Include practical examples from the codebase showing how AddChildTask and AddTask methods create parent-child and blocking relationships, and how these affect task availability. Address the emoji-based grouping feature that allows visual filtering and inheritance of emoji symbols to subtasks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for Unlimotion's Task API endpoints implemented in TaskService.cs. Document the RESTful endpoints using ServiceStack framework including GetAllTasks (GET), GetTask (GET), and BulkInsertTasks (POST) operations. Detail request/response schemas for TaskItemPage, TaskItemMold, and BulkInsertTasks models. Explain authentication via [Authenticate] attribute and JWT token validation. Describe how task relationships (ContainsTasks, BlocksTasks) are handled with ID prefixing (TaskPrefix). Document the use of RavenDB for persistence and AutoMapper for model transformation between domain and service models. Include examples of client requests with proper headers and expected responses. Address error handling scenarios such as unauthorized access and data validation failures. Explain the bulk insert pattern using RavenDB's BulkInsert functionality and its performance benefits. Provide guidance on proper URL encoding/decoding of task IDs in requests.

wiki_catalogs.name: TaskItem Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the TaskItem entity. Detail all properties including Id, UserId, Title, Description, IsCompleted (nullable bool with three-state logic), IsCanBeCompleted, CreatedDateTime, UnlockedDateTime, CompletedDateTime, ArchiveDateTime, PlannedBeginDateTime, PlannedEndDateTime, PlannedDuration, ContainsTasks, ParentTasks, BlocksTasks, BlockedByTasks, Repeater, Importance, Wanted, Version, and SortOrder. Explain the significance of each property in the task management system. Document the relationships between tasks through the ContainsTasks (children), ParentTasks (parents), BlocksTasks (tasks this task blocks), and BlockedByTasks (tasks blocking this task) collections, forming a directed acyclic graph. Describe the three-state completion logic where IsCompleted = false (active), true (completed), and null (archived), and how archived tasks are treated as completed for dependency purposes. Explain the IsCanBeCompleted property that determines if a task can be completed based on all contained and blocking tasks being completed, and how UnlockedDateTime is automatically managed when availability changes. Include the inheritance relationship between the domain model (TaskItem), view model (TaskItemViewModel), and interface model (TaskItemHubMold) for cross-layer communication.

wiki_catalogs.name: MVVM Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on Unlimotion's MVVM architecture implementation. Explain the clear separation between Views (Avalonia XAML files), ViewModels (ReactiveUI classes), and Models (domain entities). Detail how the App.axaml.cs registers services and dependencies using Splat's Locator.CurrentMutable, including the registration of MainWindowViewModel and INotificationMessageManager. Describe the ViewModel-first approach where MainWindowViewModel is instantiated in App.axaml.cs and registered as a service for dependency injection. Document the use of ReactiveUI's WhenAnyValue to bind ViewModel properties to UI elements and handle configuration persistence. Explain how commands like Create, Remove, and CreateInner are implemented as ReactiveCommand instances that interact with the taskRepository (ITaskStorage implementation). Include examples from MainWindowViewModel.cs showing how different task creation scenarios (sibling, blocked sibling, inner) are handled through distinct commands. Address how the ViewModel manages multiple task collections (CurrentItems, UnlockedItems, CompletedItems) using DynamicData's observable collections and how filters are applied based on user preferences. Provide guidance on extending the MVVM structure with new commands or views.

wiki_catalogs.name: Desktop Application Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for deploying the Unlimotion desktop application across Windows, macOS, and Linux platforms. Detail the build and packaging process using the CI scripts in the Unlimotion.Desktop/ci directory. Explain how generate-deb-pkg.sh creates .deb packages for Debian-based Linux distributions using dotnet-deb and MSBuild with specific publish settings like PublishSingleFile, SelfContained, and size-optimization flags. Document the macOS packaging workflow using generate-osx-app.sh to create .app bundles and generate-osx-pkg.sh to produce signed .pkg installers via productbuild. Cover Windows deployment through standard .NET publishing with the Unlimotion.Desktop.csproj file, including framework-dependent vs self-contained deployment options. Provide step-by-step instructions for executing these scripts, including version parameterization and environment setup. Include post-installation steps such as desktop shortcuts, file associations, and auto-update mechanisms if applicable. Address platform-specific requirements like code signing for macOS and Windows, and desktop integration on Linux via .desktop files. Document common packaging errors and troubleshooting steps.

wiki_catalogs.name: Server Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for Unlimotion's server configuration system. Detail the structure and purpose of the appsettings.json file, including Serilog logging configuration, RavenDB database settings, ServiceStack licensing, and file storage paths. Explain the AppSettings class implementation that wraps IConfiguration for ServiceStack compatibility, including how configuration values are retrieved and mapped. Document the Security section with RSA private key configuration for authentication, RavenDB server URL and data directory settings, and ServiceStack license key management. Provide examples of configuring the server for different environments (development, production), setting up custom log paths, and adjusting database locations. Include guidance on securing sensitive configuration data, managing license keys, and troubleshooting common configuration issues such as database connection failures or logging not working. Address the precedence of environment variables over JSON settings and explain how configuration values are validated during server startup.

wiki_catalogs.name: Startup Issues
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for startup issues in Unlimotion. Explain common failures during application launch across desktop, web, and server environments. Document missing .NET runtime dependencies and provide resolution steps for Windows, macOS, and Linux platforms. Address configuration-related startup errors such as malformed appsettings.json or invalid client settings. Include diagnostic procedures using entry point files like Program.cs and App.axaml.cs to trace initialization flow. Provide examples of exception handling during DI container setup and service registration. Cover platform-specific startup requirements for Android and iOS in mobile variants. Address issues related to Avalonia UI initialization and XAML parsing errors. Include debugging strategies and logging mechanisms to capture early-stage failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Git Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for Unlimotion's Git integration system. Explain how the BackupViaGitService enables automated backup and synchronization of task data using Git repositories. Detail the configuration of GitSettings including RemoteUrl, Branch, credentials (UserName/Password), commit metadata (CommitterName/Email), and scheduling intervals (PullIntervalSeconds/PushIntervalSeconds). Describe the implementation of GitPullJob and GitPushJob within the Quartz.NET scheduler for periodic synchronization. Document the clone, pull, and push workflows including conflict resolution via stashing, merge handling, and dirty state management. Explain how file changes are detected and propagated through the IDatabaseWatcher interface. Include step-by-step setup instructions for configuring a new Git repository, authentication methods (token-based), and troubleshooting common issues like authentication failures, merge conflicts, and network connectivity problems. Provide code examples from the actual implementation showing how Git operations are triggered and how UI notifications are displayed via INotificationManagerWrapper. Address security considerations for storing credentials and performance implications of frequent synchronization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Parent-Child Relationships
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for parent-child relationships in Unlimotion's task management system. Explain how the ContainsTasks and ParentTasks collections in TaskItem establish bidirectional hierarchical relationships. Document the implementation of CreateParentChildRelation and BreakParentChildRelation methods in TaskTreeManager, including transaction safety via IsCompletedAsync wrapper. Describe how AddChildTask and DeleteParentChildRelation operations trigger availability recalculation via CalculateAndUpdateAvailability on parent tasks. Include code examples showing how multiple parents enable cross-project task organization. Explain the UI representation in hierarchical views and roadmap graphs. Address common issues like circular dependencies and orphaned tasks, providing troubleshooting guidance and validation patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Breadcrumbs Navigation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the breadcrumbs navigation component in Unlimotion's interface. Explain how the breadcrumb trail enables hierarchical navigation through nested task structures, allowing users to traverse parent-child relationships efficiently. Document the implementation in MainScreen.axaml.cs and its integration with MainWindowViewModel, particularly the use of BredScrumbsAlgorithms for generating navigation paths. Describe how the UI updates reactively when users navigate between tasks, and detail the data flow from TaskWrapperViewModel to the visual breadcrumb elements. Include examples from the codebase showing how parent selection is handled and how the current context is maintained across different views. Address accessibility considerations such as keyboard navigation and screen reader support, and discuss responsive behavior on smaller screens where space is limited.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task Creation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Unlimotion's task creation operations including CreateSibling, CreateBlockedSibling, and CreateInner. Explain how the CreateSibling command in MainWindowViewModel invokes AddTask on the task repository, creating a new task at the same hierarchical level. Detail how CreateBlockedSibling establishes a blocking relationship by setting the isBlocked parameter, which triggers CreateBlockingBlockedByRelation in TaskTreeManager. Describe the CreateInner operation that creates nested child tasks using AddChildTask, which establishes parent-child relationships via CreateParentChildRelation. Include practical examples from the codebase showing how these operations modify the ContainsTasks, ParentTasks, BlocksTasks, and BlockedByTasks collections in TaskItem. Document the automatic sorting order assignment and version initialization during task creation. Address how emoji symbols are inherited from parent tasks to child tasks during creation.

wiki_catalogs.name: All Tasks View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the All Tasks view in Unlimotion. Explain how this view displays the complete hierarchical task structure with expandable parent tasks using TaskWrapperViewModel and DynamicData collections. Describe the filtering logic that respects ShowCompleted, ShowArchived, and ShowWanted configuration flags. Detail how the CurrentSortDefinition governs sorting behavior and persists user preferences via IConfiguration. Document the role of emoji-based filtering and root task identification through emoji filters. Include practical examples from MainWindowViewModel showing how ReactiveUI observables bind to the Tasks collection, transform items into wrappers, and maintain selection state across navigation. Address common issues such as performance with large task trees and synchronization of expanded states.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task Storage Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Task Storage Configuration system in Unlimotion. Explain the TaskStorageSettings class that defines storage backend configuration including local file path (Path), server URL (URL), authentication credentials (Login, Password), and the IsServerMode flag that determines the active storage type. Describe how this configuration is used by FileTaskStorage and ServerTaskStorage implementations to initialize the appropriate data persistence layer. Document the SettingsControl UI component's role in allowing users to set the storage path or server endpoint, toggle between local and server modes, and securely input login credentials. Include practical examples from the codebase showing how SettingsViewModel binds TaskStorageSettings properties to UI controls, how the application resolves storage type at startup, and how validation is handled before saving. Address security considerations around plaintext password storage and the associated TODO comment about encrypted storage. Explain integration with Splat's IConfiguration for automatic persistence across sessions.

wiki_catalogs.name: TaskItem Properties
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the TaskItem entity's core properties. Detail each property including Id (unique identifier), UserId (ownership reference), Title (task name with emoji support), Description (detailed task information), IsCompleted (three-state boolean: false=active, true=completed, null=archived), IsCanBeCompleted (calculated flag indicating if all dependencies are satisfied), CreatedDateTime (creation timestamp), UnlockedDateTime (automatically managed availability timestamp), CompletedDateTime (completion timestamp), ArchiveDateTime (archival timestamp), PlannedBeginDateTime and PlannedEndDateTime (planned execution window), PlannedDuration (expected task duration), Repeater (recurring task pattern), Importance (priority level 0-5), Wanted (favorite/starred status), Version (optimistic concurrency control), and SortOrder (sorting hint). Explain the significance of each property in the task management system, including default values, data types, and behavioral implications. Document how these properties interact with UI components and business logic, particularly around state transitions and automatic timestamp management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Local Storage
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Unlimotion's local JSON-based storage system using FileTaskStorage. Explain how tasks are stored as individual JSON files in a designated directory, with each file named by task GUID. Document the Save, Load, and Remove methods that handle file system operations and JSON serialization with IsoDateTimeConverter. Describe the initialization process in Init() that loads all tasks, performs data migration via FileTaskMigrator, and sets up reactive filtering for root tasks. Detail the integration with FileDbWatcher for file system change detection and cache synchronization. Explain the role of TaskTreeManager in maintaining transactional consistency during task operations like Add, Delete, and Update. Include practical examples from the codebase showing how blocking relationships and parent-child connections are persisted and how the MigrateIsCanBeCompleted method ensures backward compatibility by calculating initial availability states for legacy tasks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Linux Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Linux deployment of the Unlimotion desktop application. Explain how the generate-deb-pkg.sh script automates the creation of .deb packages for Debian-based distributions using the dotnet-deb tool. Document the integration with MSBuild parameters such as PublishSingleFile, SelfContained=true, and trimming options for size optimization. Describe the role of create-symlink.sh in setting up proper executable paths and desktop integration. Cover prerequisites like installing dpkg, dotnet-deb, and correct .NET SDK versions. Provide step-by-step instructions for building the package, including version injection and architecture specification. Detail post-installation behaviors such as application launcher creation, MIME type associations, and menu integration via desktop files. Include troubleshooting guidance for common issues like missing dependencies, permission errors, and broken symlinks. Address how the Unlimotion.Desktop.csproj configures the build output for Linux packaging.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Properties
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the User entity properties. Detail the Id, Login, DisplayName, AboutMe, and RegisteredTime properties from the User class in Unlimotion.Domain. Explain that Id serves as the unique identifier, Login acts as the primary authentication identifier and username, DisplayName is the user-visible name, AboutMe stores user biography or description, and RegisteredTime tracks account creation timestamp. Document how these properties are mapped to the UserProfileMold for API communication, noting that UserProfileMold is used for service-level data transfer and contains descriptive attributes for localization. Include examples of how these properties are utilized in the application for user identification, profile display, and authentication contexts.

wiki_catalogs.name: RepeaterPattern Properties
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the RepeaterPattern properties: Type (RepeaterType enum: None, Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Yearly), Period (interval multiplier), AfterComplete (whether to start counting from completion time), and Pattern (list of day indices for Weekly type). Explain how the Type property determines the recurrence frequency, how Period acts as a multiplier for the recurrence interval, and how AfterComplete affects the starting point for calculating the next occurrence. Detail how the Pattern property is used specifically for Weekly recurrence to specify which days of the week (0=Monday through 6=Sunday) the task should repeat on. Document the data types, default values, and constraints for each property. Include examples of valid configurations such as a daily task with Period=2 (every other day) or a weekly task with Pattern=[0,2,4] (Monday, Wednesday, Friday). Explain how these properties are serialized to and from the server via RepeaterPatternMold.

wiki_catalogs.name: Android App Distribution
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for distributing the Unlimotion Android application. Detail the build process using MSBuild or .NET CLI with the Unlimotion.Android.csproj file, including release configuration settings and AOT compilation if enabled. Explain how to manage versioning through AndroidManifest.xml by updating versionCode and versionName attributes, and how these map to Google Play's requirements. Document security best practices for handling server URLs, API keys, and authentication tokens in the mobile context.

wiki_catalogs.name: Docker Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for deploying the Unlimotion server using Docker. Address best practices for image tagging, caching, and minimizing attack surface in production.

wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for hosting the static assets of the Unlimotion Blazor WebAssembly application. wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture

Illustrate the dependency injection system using Splat for service registration and resolution across components. Detail the data flow from user interaction through ViewModel commands to TaskTreeManager business logic and persistent storage via IStorage implementations. Explain the cross-platform strategy using Avalonia for desktop, custom Android/iOS projects for mobile, and WebAssembly for browser access. Include system context diagrams showing client-server interactions, SignalR communication for real-time updates, and Git-based backup workflows. Illustrate how the DI container enables loose coupling between components, allowing for different ITaskStorage implementations (FileTaskStorage vs ServerTaskStorage) to be injected based on runtime configuration. Address the implications of this service location pattern versus constructor injection and how it affects testability and component lifecycle management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Features

Document the reactive pipeline that connects the task repository to the UI, sorting tasks in descending order by creation time. Describe how emoji and exclusion filters are applied to refine the displayed results. Include examples showing how creating a new task immediately appears in this view. Address how the view handles dynamic updates when tasks are created or when the date filter is modified, and how the view state is persisted across sessions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Scheduling and Recurrence Properties
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for TaskItem scheduling properties: PlannedDuration (expected time investment), Repeater (recurring task configuration), and their interaction with the scheduling system. Explain how PlannedDuration influences UnlockedDateTime calculation via PlannedDurationBehavior, and how it integrates with time tracking. Document the RepeaterPattern object's structure (Type, Interval, Count, etc.) and its role in generating recurring task instances. Include examples from GitPullJob and TaskService showing recurrence processing, and how Repeater affects task cloning and completion. Address edge cases like overlapping recurrences, timezone shifts, and duration-based availability cascades.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for Unlimotion's server endpoints and real-time communication interfaces. For RESTful APIs, document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication methods using the ServiceStack framework. Detail the TaskService endpoints for CRUD operations on tasks, including filtering, searching, and relationship management. For WebSocket APIs via SignalR, document the ChatHub methods for real-time task updates, user presence, and collaborative features. Explain the message formats for task synchronization events and user notifications. Document the service interfaces in Unlimotion.Interface such as IChatHub and IProfile that define contracts between server and clients. Include authentication mechanisms using the Auth service with token-based access and user management endpoints. Provide examples of client implementation showing how desktop, web, and mobile clients consume these APIs. Address security considerations including data encryption, rate limiting, and input validation. Document API versioning strategy and backwards compatibility approaches. Include error handling patterns with standardized response codes and messages. Explain how the Telegram bot interacts with the server through these APIs to enable remote task management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Last Opened View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Last Opened view, which tracks recently viewed tasks for quick access. Explain how LastOpenedItems in MainWindowViewModel is populated through a subscription to CurrentTaskItem and DetailsAreOpen properties, using LastOpenedSource as a backing collection. Document how the view maintains a reverse-chronological list of visited tasks with special timestamps for identification. Describe the implementation of the Recently Opened feature that allows users to quickly return to previously viewed tasks. Include examples showing how opening a task detail panel adds it to this list. Address limitations such as maximum list size and persistence behavior across application restarts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Integration Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive integration documentation for Unlimotion's external services. Explain the setup process for Git repository integration, including configuring GitSettings with repository URL, credentials, and scheduling for automated backups via GitPullJob and GitPushJob. Detail the Telegram bot integration, covering bot token configuration, command handling, and synchronization with the user's task database. Document server configuration for centralized task storage using RavenDB, including connection string setup and user authentication. Explain mobile app configuration for Android and iOS platforms, including platform-specific build requirements and deployment procedures. Describe the process of connecting multiple clients to the same server instance for collaborative task management. Include step-by-step guides with configuration examples from appsettings.json and GitSettings.cs. Address common integration issues such as authentication failures, network connectivity problems, and data synchronization conflicts. Provide troubleshooting tips for each integration point and performance optimization suggestions for high-latency connections.

wiki_catalogs.name: Development Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on setting up a development environment for Unlimotion. Explain the prerequisites including installing .NET 9.0 SDK, Git, and platform-specific tools for mobile development. Provide step-by-step instructions for cloning the repository from GitHub and restoring NuGet packages. Document the build process for different platforms using the provided startup scripts (run.windows.cmd, run.macos.sh, run.linux.sh) and Visual Studio solutions. Explain how to run the application in development mode with proper configuration of appsettings.json and .env files. Detail the testing strategy using the Unlimotion.Test project with xUnit and Moq for unit tests, including how to run tests and interpret results. Provide debugging tips for common issues such as dependency injection failures, UI binding errors, and database connection problems. Explain the contribution workflow including branching strategy, code formatting rules, and pull request requirements. Include performance profiling techniques and memory leak detection methods specific to Avalonia and ReactiveUI applications. Address platform-specific considerations for debugging mobile builds on Android and iOS devices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive deployment documentation for Unlimotion across all platforms. Explain desktop application packaging for Windows, macOS, and Linux using the build scripts in Unlimotion.Desktop/ci directory, including generating .deb packages for Debian and .pkg installers for macOS. Document server deployment options including standalone execution, Docker containerization using the provided Dockerfile, and orchestration with docker-compose.yml for multi-container environments. Describe web application hosting requirements for the Blazor-based browser version, including static file serving and WebAssembly considerations. Explain mobile app distribution through Google Play Store and Apple App Store, covering signing requirements and submission processes. Provide configuration guidelines for production environments including security hardening, backup strategies, and monitoring setup. Include scaling recommendations for the RavenDB server component and load balancing options for high-availability deployments. Address data migration procedures when upgrading between versions and rollback strategies for failed deployments. Document environment-specific variables in .env files and their impact on system behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive configuration documentation for Unlimotion's settings system. Detail the appsettings.json file structure for server configuration including connection strings, security settings, and service endpoints. Explain the TaskStorageSettings model that controls local task storage path, file format options, and synchronization behavior. Document the GitSettings configuration for automated backup including repository URL, branch, commit message patterns, and schedule intervals. Describe the ClientSettings for user authentication and server connection parameters. Explain the structure of .env files for environment-specific variables and their precedence over configuration files. Provide examples of common configuration scenarios such as setting up a custom storage location, configuring Git integration with SSH authentication, and connecting to a remote server instance. Address configuration validation rules and error messages that appear when settings are invalid. Include migration guidance when configuration formats change between versions. Document the fallback mechanisms when required settings are missing and the default values used in such cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Troubleshooting
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive troubleshooting documentation for Unlimotion. Address common issues such as application startup failures, database connection errors, and synchronization problems between clients. Explain error messages related to missing .NET runtime components and provide solutions for different operating systems. Document issues with Git integration including authentication failures, merge conflicts, and repository permission errors. Describe problems with task availability calculations and how to diagnose incorrect blocking states using the implementation details from IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md. Address performance issues with large task databases and provide optimization tips such as indexing strategies and query optimization. Explain mobile-specific issues like push notification failures and platform permission requirements. Provide debugging techniques using the unit tests in Unlimotion.Test as diagnostic tools and logging strategies to capture problematic behavior. Include recovery procedures for corrupted task data and steps to rebuild the availability cache. Document known limitations and workarounds for incomplete features listed in the README backlog.

<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: Unlimotion

## 1. Project Introduction

Unlimotion is a sophisticated task management application designed to provide unlimited levels of task nesting, flexible task relationships, and robust data management capabilities. The application enables users to create complex task hierarchies where tasks can be subtasks of multiple parent tasks simultaneously, effectively replacing traditional tagging systems with hierarchical organization.

### Purpose Statement
The primary purpose of Unlimotion is to provide a flexible and powerful task management system that supports complex project structures with interdependent tasks, while maintaining data privacy by storing information locally on the user's device.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Enable unlimited task nesting levels for complex project organization
- Support multiple parent relationships for tasks to facilitate cross-project task management
- Implement task blocking mechanisms to enforce execution order
- Provide multiple visualization modes including hierarchical views, roadmaps, and filtered lists
- Ensure data persistence and backup through Git integration

### Target Audience
Unlimotion targets professionals, project managers, and individuals who manage complex projects with interdependent tasks across multiple domains. The application is particularly suited for users who need to organize tasks in non-linear hierarchies and require advanced filtering and visualization capabilities.

Sources:
- [README.md](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\README.md)

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown

Unlimotion follows a modular architecture with clear separation of concerns across multiple projects within the solution. The application is built using the Avalonia UI framework for cross-platform desktop applications, with additional components for web, mobile, and server functionality.

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Unlimotion.Desktop] --> B[Unlimotion]
    C[Unlimotion.Browser] --> B
    D[Unlimotion.Android] --> B
    E[Unlimotion.iOS] --> B
    F[Unlimotion.Server] --> G[Unlimotion.Domain]
    H[Unlimotion.ViewModel] --> G
    I[Unlimotion.TaskTreeManager] --> G
    J[Unlimotion.Interface] --> F
    K[Unlimotion.TelegramBot] --> F
    B --> H
    B --> I
    B --> J
    F --> L[Unlimotion.Server.ServiceInterface]
    F --> M[Unlimotion.Server.ServiceModel]
```

### Design Patterns

The application implements several key design patterns:

1. **Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM)**: The core architectural pattern used throughout the application, with clear separation between UI components and business logic.

2. **Dependency Injection**: Uses Splat library for service registration and resolution, enabling loose coupling between components.

3. **Reactive Programming**: Leverages ReactiveUI and DynamicData libraries for reactive data binding and stream-based data processing.

4. **Repository Pattern**: Implemented through the ITaskStorage interface and its concrete implementations for different storage backends.

5. **Command Pattern**: Used extensively for UI actions and operations, providing undo/redo capabilities and separation of concerns.

### System Relationships

The system consists of multiple interconnected components that communicate through well-defined interfaces:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    Client[Desktop/Browser Client] --> API[Server API]
    API --> DB[(RavenDB)]
    Client --> FileStorage[File-based Storage]
    Client --> Git[Git Backup]
    TelegramBot[Telegram Bot] --> API
    Server[Server Component] --> DB
    Server --> API
    Client --> Notification[Notification System]
    Client --> Scheduling[Quartz Scheduler]
    
    style Client fill:#4CAF50,stroke:#388E3C
    style API fill:#2196F3,stroke:#1976D2
    style DB fill:#F44336,stroke:#D32F2F
    style FileStorage fill:#FF9800,stroke:#F57C00
    style Git fill:#607D8B,stroke:#455A64
```

### Data Flow

The data flow in Unlimotion follows a consistent pattern across different components:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[User Interaction] --> B[ViewModel Command]
    B --> C[Service Layer]
    C --> D[Data Access Layer]
    D --> E[(Persistent Storage)]
    E --> F[Data Change Notification]
    F --> G[ViewModel Update]
    G --> H[UI Update]
    H --> A
    
    I[External Changes] --> J[File Watcher/Database Sync]
    J --> F
```

Sources:
- [App.axaml.cs](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\src\Unlimotion\App.axaml.cs)
- [MainWindowViewModel.cs](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\src\Unlimotion.ViewModel\MainWindowViewModel.cs)
- [TaskStorages.cs](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\src\Unlimotion\TaskStorages.cs)

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points

The application has multiple entry points for different platforms and deployment scenarios:

- **Desktop Application**: `Unlimotion.Desktop\Program.cs` - Entry point for the desktop application
- **Web Application**: `Unlimotion.Browser\Program.cs` - Entry point for the web/browser version
- **Server Component**: `Unlimotion.Server\Program.cs` - Entry point for the server component
- **Telegram Bot**: `Unlimotion.TelegramBot\Program.cs` - Entry point for the Telegram integration

### Core Modules

**Task Management Core** (`Unlimotion` project):
- Implements the primary task management functionality
- Contains view models, services, and behaviors for task operations
- Manages the connection between UI and data storage

**Domain Models** (`Unlimotion.Domain` project):
- Defines core entities such as TaskItem, User, and RepeaterPattern
- Contains business logic and validation rules
- Provides data transfer objects for serialization

**View Models** (`Unlimotion.ViewModel` project):
- Implements the MVVM pattern with reactive properties
- Handles user interactions and commands
- Manages data filtering and presentation logic

**Server Components** (`Unlimotion.Server` project):
- Provides REST API endpoints for task management
- Implements authentication and authorization
- Uses RavenDB as the primary data store

### Configuration Approach

The application uses a hierarchical configuration system with JSON files and environment-specific settings:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Configuration] --> B[appsettings.json]
    A --> C[appsettings.Development.json]
    A --> D[Settings.json]
    A --> E[.env file]
    B --> F[RavenDB Settings]
    B --> G[Serilog Settings]
    C --> H[Development Logging]
    D --> I[Task Storage Path]
    D --> J[Git Backup Settings]
    E --> K[Environment Variables]
    
    style A fill:#9C27B0,stroke:#7B1FA2
    style B fill:#3F51B5,stroke:#303F9F
    style C fill:#3F51B5,stroke:#303F9F
    style D fill:#3F51B5,stroke:#303F9F
    style E fill:#3F51B5,stroke:#303F9F
```

Key configuration files:
- `appsettings.json`: Primary server configuration with database and security settings
- `Settings.json`: Client configuration for task storage and backup settings
- `.env`: Environment variables for deployment configuration

Sources:
- [appsettings.json](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\src\Unlimotion.Server\appsettings.json)
- [appsettings.Development.json](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\src\Unlimotion.Server\appsettings.Development.json)
- [App.axaml.cs](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\src\Unlimotion\App.axaml.cs)

### External Dependencies

The project relies on several key external libraries and frameworks:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Unlimotion] --> B[AvaloniaUI]
    A --> C[ReactiveUI]
    A --> D[DynamicData]
    A --> E[Quartz.NET]
    A --> F[ServiceStack]
    A --> G[AutoMapper]
    A --> H[RavenDB]
    A --> I[Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration]
    B --> J[Cross-platform UI]
    C --> K[Reactive Programming]
    D --> L[Reactive Collections]
    E --> M[Scheduling]
    F --> N[Web Services]
    G --> O[Object Mapping]
    H --> P[Document Database]
    I --> Q[Configuration Management]
```

### Integration Points

The application integrates with several external systems:

1. **Git Repository**: For task backup and synchronization
2. **Telegram Bot**: For remote task management and notifications
3. **RavenDB**: As the primary server-side data store
4. **File System**: For local task storage in JSON format
5. **Notification System**: For desktop notifications

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Unlimotion] --> B[Git Repository]
    A --> C[Telegram]
    A --> D[RavenDB]
    A --> E[File System]
    A --> F[Desktop Notifications]
    B --> G[GitHub/GitLab]
    C --> H[Telegram Cloud]
    D --> I[Document Database]
    E --> J[Local Storage]
    F --> K[OS Notification Center]
```

Sources:
- [GitSettings.cs](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\src\Unlimotion\GitSettings.cs)
- [appsettings.json](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\src\Unlimotion.Server\appsettings.json)
- [TaskStorages.cs](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\src\Unlimotion\TaskStorages.cs)

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview

Unlimotion provides a comprehensive set of features for task management:

1. **Hierarchical Task Organization**: Unlimited levels of task nesting with support for multiple parents
2. **Task Blocking**: Tasks can be blocked by other tasks, creating execution dependencies
3. **Multiple Views**: Different perspectives on tasks including All Tasks, Unlocked, Completed, and Roadmap views
4. **Emoji Filtering**: Tasks can be filtered by emoji characters in their titles
5. **Git Integration**: Automatic backup of tasks to Git repositories
6. **Cross-Platform Support**: Available on desktop, web, and mobile platforms

### Implementation Highlights

**Task State Management**:
The application implements a finite state machine for task states with well-defined transitions:

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    uncomplited: Not completed
    inprogress: In progress
    archieved: Archieved
    completed: Completed
    [*] --> uncomplited: Creation
    uncomplited --> [*]: Deleting
    completed--> [*]: Deleting
    archieved --> [*]: Deleting
    uncomplited --> completed
    uncomplited --> archieved
    uncomplited --> inprogress
    inprogress --> uncomplited
    inprogress --> completed
    completed --> uncomplited
    archieved --> uncomplited
```

**Task Relationships**:
Tasks can have four types of relationships:
- Parent tasks (contain this task)
- Containing tasks (children of this task)
- Blocking tasks (must be completed before this task)
- Blocked tasks (cannot be completed until this task is done)

**Data Synchronization**:
The application uses a sophisticated synchronization mechanism to keep data consistent across different storage backends:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Local Changes] --> B[Immediate Save]
    B --> C{Server Mode?}
    C -->|Yes| D[Sync with Server]
    C -->|No| E[Git Backup Job]
    D --> F[Server Database]
    E --> G[Git Repository]
    F --> H[Other Clients]
    G --> I[Other Instances]
    H --> J[Real-time Updates]
    I --> K[Pull on Startup]
```

Sources:
- [README.md](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\README.md)
- [MainWindowViewModel.cs](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\src\Unlimotion.ViewModel\MainWindowViewModel.cs)
- [TaskItem.cs](c:\Projects\Education\Unlimotion Space\Unlimotion\src\Unlimotion.Domain\TaskItem.cs)
</blog>
